title: Attitude Transformation Program Through Activity-Based Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Aims to improve mathematical thinking and problem-solving attitudes among practicing professionals, requiring design considerations for smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners improve their positive attitude toward mathematics by over 80% through applying mathematical approaches in real-life problem situations
Learners develop the ability to accept peer feedback by over 70% when solving mathematical problems through collaborative activities
Learners can specifically diagnose and report their level of attitude change through at least four formative assessments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
